record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name=NULL and term="Window open command panel" and format.name="wopen" and syslanguage="en"
record.recordid: Window open command panel - wopen - en
record.format.name: wopen

brief.brief: The Window Open command panel opens a window.

detail.detail: Parent Window Name: (character) Specify the parent window (the window in which to create the new window.) If this field is empty (NULL), Service Manager makes the Main window the parent.
Create Window Name: (character) Specify the window to create.
Top/Right/Left/Bottom: (character) Specify whether to place the new window at the top, bottom, left, or right side of the parent window.
Create Window as Percent/Lines: (number) Specify a percentage of the parent window or the number of lines or columns you want the new window to be.
The new window must be greater than 0% of the parent window and less than or equal to 100% of the parent window.

Service Manager selects the newly opened window for future I/O and displays all subsequent record display, input (rio), and table display (fdisp) panels in the new window until it encounters a window select or window close in the application.
The screen contains three system-defined windows automatically, the Main window, the Option window, and the Message window.
If the parent window name is blank, it defaults to the Main window.
